title: Echostar Holding Corp (SATS) Receives $73.00 Consensus Target Price from Brokerages
content: Shares of Echostar Holding Corp (NASDAQ:SATS) have been assigned a consensus rating of “Hold” from the five research firms that are presently  covering the stock, MarketBeat.com reports. One investment analyst  has rated the stock with a sell recommendation, two have assigned  a hold recommendation and one  has assigned  a buy recommendation to  the company. The average 12-month price objective among analysts that have issued ratings on the stock in the last year is $73.00.    A number of research analysts have commented on SATS shares. Citigroup raised their target price on shares of Echostar from $71.00 to $76.00 and gave the company a “buy” rating in a research report on Monday, February 26th. Zacks Investment Research raised shares of Echostar from a “hold” rating to a “buy” rating and set a $67.00 target price on the stock in a research report on Tuesday, February 27th. TheStreet raised shares of Echostar from a “c+” rating to a “b-” rating in a research report on Tuesday, February 27th. Finally, BidaskClub raised shares of Echostar from a “sell” rating to a “hold” rating in a research report on Wednesday, April 11th.    Get Echostar alerts:      In other news, Director Tom A. Ortolf sold 5,000 shares of Echostar stock in a transaction that occurred on Monday, February 26th. The shares were sold at an average price of $59.71, for a total value of $298,550.00. The sale was disclosed in a filing with the SEC, which is accessible through this hyperlink . Also, CFO David Rayner sold 4,073 shares of Echostar stock in a transaction that occurred on Monday, February 26th. The stock was sold at an average price of $59.67, for a total transaction of $243,035.91. Following the completion of the transaction, the chief financial officer now directly owns 7,246 shares in the company, valued at approximately $432,368.82. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . Insiders have sold a total of 13,073 shares of company stock worth $776,626 in the last three months. Insiders own  73.54% of the company’s stock.      Several institutional investors have recently modified their holdings of the company. Xact Kapitalforvaltning AB grew its position in shares of  Echostar by 19.5% in the 1st quarter. Xact Kapitalforvaltning AB now owns 6,116 shares of the communications equipment provider’s stock worth $323,000 after buying an additional 1,000 shares during the last quarter.  Geode Capital Management LLC grew its position in shares of  Echostar by 0.3% in the 4th quarter. Geode Capital Management LLC now owns 433,014 shares of the communications equipment provider’s stock worth $25,937,000 after buying an additional 1,222 shares during the last quarter.  UBS Asset Management Americas Inc. grew its position in shares of  Echostar by 2.8% in the 4th quarter. UBS Asset Management Americas Inc. now owns 57,069 shares of the communications equipment provider’s stock worth $3,418,000 after buying an additional 1,568 shares during the last quarter.  Swiss National Bank grew its position in shares of  Echostar by 2.1% in the 4th quarter. Swiss National Bank now owns 81,700 shares of the communications equipment provider’s stock worth $4,894,000 after buying an additional 1,700 shares during the last quarter.  Finally, Sei Investments Co. grew its position in shares of  Echostar by 2.5% in the 1st quarter. Sei Investments Co. now owns 72,306 shares of the communications equipment provider’s stock worth $3,816,000 after buying an additional 1,730 shares during the last quarter. 46.19% of the stock is currently owned by hedge funds and other institutional investors.    NASDAQ SATS traded down $0.43 during trading on Friday, reaching $50.52. 235,900 shares of the company’s stock traded hands, compared to its average volume of 207,584. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.85, a quick ratio of 8.78 and a current ratio of 8.99. The company has a market capitalization of $4.88 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 60.14, a price-to-earnings-growth ratio of 11.57 and a beta of 0.82. Echostar has a 12-month low of $50.42 and a 12-month high of $62.50.    Echostar (NASDAQ:SATS) last posted its earnings results on Thursday, May 10th. The communications equipment provider reported $0.16 EPS for the quarter, beating analysts’ consensus estimates of $0.05 by $0.11. The business had revenue of $501.79 million for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $492.55 million. Echostar had a net margin of 17.06% and a return on equity of 1.61%. The company’s revenue for the quarter was up 15.8% on a year-over-year basis. During the same quarter last year, the firm posted $0.41 EPS.  equities analysts expect that  Echostar will post 0.88 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.    About Echostar    EchoStar Corporation provides satellite service operations and video delivery solutions worldwide. It operates in two segments, Hughes and EchoStar Satellite Services. The Hughes segments offers broadband satellite technologies and Internet services for home and small office customers; and broadband network technologies, managed services, equipment, hardware, satellite services, and communication solutions for aeronautical, enterprise, and government customers, as well as consumers.
